chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald Allen Koch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gerald Allen Koch is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gerald Allen Koch was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber privileges.  Jail to commence immediately after sentence in Richland Co.  May transfer to Richland Co.  Provide DNA Sample.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gerald Allen Koch in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 1:  Dismissed 

Count 2:
$543.00 fine or costs, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
Provide DNA Sample
80 Days in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive.  Commence immediately after Richland Co. sentence
May transfer to Richland Co. 
Paperwork handed in court.
Final pre-trial on July 25, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on August 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gerald Allen Koch in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Gerald Allen Koch in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.
Return date on April 28, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Gerald Allen Koch in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Gerald Allen Koch in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Offer has been extended.  Request another reset 30 days. State request status of incarceration.  In Richland Co. at least another month.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Gerald Allen Koch
Current: 1080 E Kinder Street, PO Box 384, Richland Center, WI 53581   (Effective: 03-08-2016)
Prior: 1080 E Kinder Street, Richland Center, WI 53581

Pre-trial conference on April 1, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Return date on April 13, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Gerald Allen Koch appeared by video means with Attorney Raabe. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State gives criminal history.  State request $500 cash bond w/ conditions.  Attorney Raabe confirms address.  Defendant will likely qualify.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with J.W.  Absolute sobriety.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Return date scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
